text: if you start open sourcing things then
first of all you have a record of your
work that anyone can look up and so next
time you get to a company and you go to
the interviewing at the company you can
point and say okay this is what I've
written right we can discuss that this
is why I've done it but it's no longer
oh I've done this thing but I cannot
show anything because it was Private to
my company right so now also unlike with
discussions are concrete and they can
pretty much replace the Whiteboard
coding interviews because
like why why would you like I would
never give someone a whiteboard coding
interview right now if you bring me here
my open source projects this is what I
contributed this is my commit and we can
discuss it like wow like it makes a lot
more sense so this is a great part it
removes like this whole problem with
interviewing this whole nervousness this
whole like on a Spotify okay so that's
great but another thing that will
supercharge you after a couple of years
probably if you keep it up right is but
you're going to be invited to join the
companies just based on your open source
work right like people will email you a
LinkedIn or whatever just talk to you
and say okay hey why don't you come on
board you know this tool you've done
this like awesome job right here why
don't you join us it's a huge change and
you just have to keep it up with open
source work will it happen like on a
clock probably not but it probably will
happen but there is another I would say
complementary work to just programming
programming is great coding is great but
you have to write you have to write blog
post you have to write presentations you
have to promote your work you have to
explain it and you'll benefit yourself
from doing it and other people will
understand what you're doing
the number of people who's gonna look at
your source code is probably like single
digits maybe someone reviews your pull
request maybe someone digs in to how the
library works very small but if you
write a blog post saying this is how you
do let's say in my case like unit
testing or testing a node program or
testing CLI program on testing a website
the number of people who will read it
could be thousands
[Music]
